comments.commentBody:
Smart but slow safeties
Big slow WR that cant get out of a break and when he does drops the ball
Thin OL depth
Thin RB depth
Heroic NT by committee but we need a big butt to clog the middle
LB's aren't real fast so middle/deep is pretty open when combined with slow safeties

Chemistry is huge in team sports and I don't see these guys loving each other- Rex sticks up for them but I think they rely on him too much and in the end the players make the plays right?

I can't believe these people have not been evicted from the park. They are a nuisance and a public health hazard. Since when do they have a right to camp out in the city indefinitely. Clean yourselves up and go find a job. But I guess it's easier to sit around all day with your hands out.

How many leaves are on one million trees?

Do you know that as the leaves disintegrate, they expel Carbon Dioxide?
Can there ever be enough trees?
I blame the bankers who run the federal reserve! If we truly want to fix the situation we must elect a president who has a plan to go in the opposite direction. ELECT DR. RON PAUL!!!!!!!

The dire situation in Greece commands the attention of the entire world. Violent uprisings will not improve the situation. It remains to be seen if the current Socialist Government responsible for this debacle will provide good stewardship of the massive loan provided by the EU.  Economic austerity is needed.  But the basic needs of the Greek people must be met. Sacrifices must be made by all in order to turn this emergency around.

Real Estate crash, Wall Street Crash, or failure Government prudential expenditure -all could be avoided. Whether its Greece, Portugal, Ireland and even the US, most people are living beyond their means, and most executive Civil Servants are sucking dry the public purse for early comfortable retirement. The US with its 99% Debt to GDP is heading down the same path as Greece, Ireland and Portugal. No wonder why housing prices are falling in the US and the dollar value is being reduced to the fair value of its GDP v Debt. The only economies immune from the issue of the GFC and economic crash is  the Asian/ Pacific economies of China, Australia, and India. What happens in Greece should be lessons learnt for the US. Hyper inflated real estate, without any fiscal support. At least other international economies such as Neverland, Canada, Australia and New Zealand, have a fall back to stimulate spending with Interest rates above a flat 0%. China has a growth 9%, Australian un-employemnt only 5%, Indian Terms of Trade 2.9 billion surplus. Perhaps we should have been smarter and more prudent as those Asian pacific economies to get us out of this North American and European disease of over spending. No wonder why the housing bubble burst - Prudent Govt and banking systems. We have no one to blame but ourselves.

Greece needs to get off the Euro, let its new currency float downward, and thereby make Greek products and services a bargain compared to those from the rest of Europe. The economy will pick up quickly.

I think that pitching wins this series because both teams have equal hitting abilities. With that being said I think that although the Rangers pitching has been great at times I'd give the upper hand to the Cardinals because of the experience of the staff. All in all the series should be exciting and I see the series going into at least 6 or 7 with the advantage going to the Cardinals.

Who's laughing at this "joke?"

Anybody?

No one is laughing because it's not funny, and was not meant to be. It was intended to hurt, to intimidate, and to remind the students who is in charge.

Despicable.
A dose of humble pie, and a little less attention from the likes of Fox and ESPN, are just what the Red Sox need.  Even if they are served with chicken and beer.
Perhaps the Cubbies can send Carlos Zambrano to the Sox as compensation for Epstein.  Boston needs pitching and Zambrano is as likely to punch out a teammate as to share a beer with him.

Well, at least you can look at it this way: These fans are so consumed by this team (and the real die hards always have been, thick or thin - mostly thin) - that they are into this whole drama now, like a soap opera, and it's football season, hockey season, two other teams are in the WS and, to be blunt - pretty much every franchise in either league wishes they had this sort of fanatical interest. ("Fan" is derived from "Fanatic.")

Let it roll!!!

Tariffs and trade embargo in this time? Fair on unfair, it will make the econommic situation much worse than it already is. At least chinese panels offered at low price benefits the US by greening our energy and by providing jobs to installers. That's better than nothing. Considering that Obama and the GOP killed the US renewable energy initiative, we can't hardly complain that the Chinese are the sole responsible for our problems in that area (and elsewhere as well)!

Whether it is caused by a blow to the head (Traumatic Brain Injury) or lack of blood to the brain due to blockage or vessel rupture (Stroke) EVERY SECOND COUNTS !!
Loss of consciousness for ANY reason is reason enough to transport the victim to a hospital ASAP, hesitation of seconds can mean the difference between a normal recovery & a persistent vegetative state .

From the article

"Barden’s helmet, a Riddell Revolution, was purchased by the school two years ago directly from Riddell. It was reconditioned after last season and recertified for use in 2011 by Stadium System, a company based in Canaan, Conn., that reconditions helmets for hundreds of schools around the country."

How is a helmet "reconditioned"?

Does the process result in the helmet being strengthened or weakened?

Football is an unsafe activity.  Aside from these acute injuries, it is associated with Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy, a disease I suspect none of the players or coaches or parents are even aware of.   Ban the sport.  Sadly, there's too much interest and money on the line.

Accidents can happen in any sport, but football seems designed to cause injury.  How many other high school sports have ambulances standing by?  Sudden death aside, a more disturbing and pervasive problem seems to be the possibility of long term brain damage.  I admit to enjoying the game as a spectator, but if I had a son, I wouldn't allow him to play.

The article is looking at the wrong thing. Change the way the game is played rather than design a helment for the impossible role.

As an observer from outside the US (Australia actually), American Football seems to be the only body contact sport that allows contact with the opponents head as part of normal play. Even worse than that, offensive players by conscious decision seem to aim their head at an opponent in a battering ram type tackle.

The helmet designed to protect a players head is used as a weapon in play.

In other contact sports like Rugby Union, Rugby League and Australian Football "spear" tackles which lift a player's lower body high and drive his head into the ground are banned. It is a send-off offence with guaranteed disqualification for later matches.

The reason why the Greeks are in this mess in the first place is because they got into cahoots with AMERICAN banks.  Get real folks, it's not entirely their fault.  Sure, they do have issues with not paying taxes.  I've experienced it there myself when I lived there.  Garbage day is random, electricity, shaky at times.  Definitely problems with their infrastructure.  But their bad habits didn't push them over the edge.  They were thrown off the cliffs by the banks.  The punishment does not equal their "crime."  That's ludicrous.

# 183 The hypocrisy is very simple, the analogy crying out. You send flotillas to supply Hamas, a terrorist organization that aims to destroy the state of Israel and ethnically cleanse its Jewish population, and at the same time you brutally suppress the Kurds, who do not intend to destroy your country, only to exercise self determination in areas where they are a majority.

China is a rogue nation.  Just Google "Chinese Girl gets run over by a car".  Nixon made a strategic blunder when he played the china card; we have compounded the problem by allowing our manufacturing to shift to china.  We need a new strategic plan.

Everybody should read the signs of the times. The weather patterns follow the attitude patterns of the people in the world. The weather goes into extremes, so do people. The weather changes in short succession, so do people. The weather harms nature’s sustainability, so do people harming their own sustainability. The breach between nature’s tranquillity and distress is becoming more obvious, so it is between people economic status. It is near impossible to keep nature free from corruption, so it is with people, etc. etc. etc..
How can we change to improve, please read the following for your information:
http://theworldmonetaryordertocome.blogspot.com/2010/11/introduction.html

Yep, and the government-Red or Blue- and business knew it. The Japanese did it too, with whatever they could get away with. Remember? Let's not be naive: this is what lies beneath the surface of our political and economic pain.
Checked with farmers in Africa lately about the agriculture subsidies in the US?
